subject: for Frank and Chuck Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: That's Why!
author: LC Duplatt
full_text:
Ron, yes...I say do both.  

I am for whatever works for people in their given situation.  As you 
pointed out, there is value in an intelligent response to a 
question.  Sometimes we need to just let it run and listen, too. 

I try and follow my "gut" with it.  For example, I was at a haunted 
pub, but was skeptical as to the claim of such.  As the night 
progressed, I felt a presence touch me twice.  One place I was "drawn 
to" was the top of some stairs, so I ran a silent box session there - 
just me and whoever wanted to show up - no agenda.  I was able to 
pull out a number of messages after listening to the recording a 
couple times, and one word which I heard live was "raped."  Later, I 
found out that a woman was indeed raped there, and the door I was 
sitting in front of was the former entrance to a brothel.  The woman 
raped and murdered was a prostitute who lost her life up there.  
Follow the gut...there's no rule or law that will work everywhere, 
every time, IMHO.

Regarding EVP, it seems to me that many EVP seem to come near or 
around people talking on the tape.  Do they use the human voices as a 
carrier??  

LC

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Ron Lederer <ronriko@...> wrote:
>
> All good points chuck. I am wondering what your reaction is to the 
questioner who gets an immediate and appropriate response to his 
question as Mike just did regarding equipment. His question was well 
designed and the response was direct and immediate. He would then 
have time to "just listen" no? Can't we do both? Ask, as times, and 
listen at other times? Also, Frank, I know you discussed this in the 
past but what has the history of SW radio usage and EVP results? Ron 
L

> Frank, I understand where you are coming from, as I often get 
> frustrated when I hear myself or another asking a question and 
there 
> is an answer within the same audio from the spirits. So I agree 
with 
> this. I only hear about 10% of the answers live, and find re-
> listening to the recording at least two times is beneficial to 
catch 
> everything.
> 
> However, we were at a lighthouse that was supposed to be haunted, 
and 
> a lady asked if there was a "Captain Babcock" with us. About 8 
> seconds later, the reply, "Spirit of Babcock" came through clearly. 
> The file is in my folder here. So I do see value as well in asking 
> questions. The downside is we have a tendency to talk over them 
> sometimes, yet, it is nice to provide the earthbounds direction to 
> help them speak what we need to hear (to help them). If people 
think 
> they do not need help, then they haven't been doing this enough in 
> places where people in spirit are in trauma. Believe me, some of 
> them truly are and are in need of help - period. 
> 
> Perhaps there are two ways to do this, depending on what one is 
> trying to accomplish. At a haunted location, I seem to hear 
> enlightened spirits, as well as earthbounds coming through. This 
> type of situation can be especially helpful to ask questions in my 
> experience, as it helps to ferret out what's going on there and 
> provide "evidence" of intelligent responses to the questions. This 
> worked well to prove the spirit box as legit to the group who 
> accompanied me.
> 
> When just trying to get "higher" messages from spirits, etc at home 
> or elsewhere, I do think just letting it run and record is a great 
> way to work with it, too. This way, there are no expectations, just 
> taking the time to listen for direction, messages of truth, hellos, 
> etc. Sometimes this way will really surprise you, especially when 
> something comes through "off the cuff" and you are not expecting 
it. 
> 
> Frank, I hear your advice captain, but also want to throw in some 
of 
> my personal experiences into the discussion.
> 
> LC
>
